item.title: Be More Ocean
item.description:
This series of programs aims to introduce and communicate concepts of oceanography through a scientific expedition on the game Sea of ​​Thieves.

Your journey will be led by Professor Ernest Medusa, a talented explorer and ecologist, who will guide you through various programs. Our goal will be to understand how the game's ecosystems work and whether they are scientifically plausible.

Several topics will be discussed:

  • physics (winds and currents)
  • geology
  • water chemistry
  • aquatic biology
  • land biology
  • human civilizations

The expedition Journal is available here.

item.title: Chouettos Cup
item.description:
The Chouettos Cup is a friendly competition offered to the community on Discord and during live broadcasts.

Inspired from the House Cup system in the Harry Potter universe, community members can join one of the three participating Societies during a livestream (random assignment in exchange for a few channel points ):

  • the Collectors of Science
  • the Knowledge Alliance
  • the Ordre of Scholars

Viewer interactions during livestreams can earn or lose points for their Society, and bonus points are awarded through monthly challenges to be completed on the Discord server. Proposed by the moderation team, these challenges are tied to the community’s lore and current mood, allowing everyone to participate by organizing their efforts through dedicated discussion channels.

item.title: An ocean of knowledge
item.description:
To celebrate the 2024 Science Party, an event organized by the French Ministry of Higher Education and Research, I organized a special program to discuss scientific knowledge in the time of piracy. Accompanied by Astragale and Romain from the channel Le Flot de l’Histoire, we discussed many topics:

  • fantastic creatures debunked
  • women and feminism in the Age of piracy
  • pirate democracy during the Golden age

I was also on the channel of Oamgui to co-host a livestream about marine stations. We watched and discussed several videos about these places, their founders, and their importance for scientific research, including an excellent movie on their history.

item.title: Science and gamedesign
item.description:
I had the honor and pleasure of welcoming Clémence Maurer, senior level designer for Unknown Worlds. She and her team participated in the development of the environments and creatures for the Subnautica franchise.

While wandering in Subnautica Below Zero, we explored the ecosystems and discussed their creation, inspirations for their elements and their scientific plausibility. It was a wonderful experience, one I can’t wait to repeat! Especially since I got exclusive information on Subnautica 2, which will be released in 2025…

item.title: RPG session - The infected UFO
item.description:
To celebrate the 2024 Oceans Week, an international event organized and supported by the United Nations, we organized a role-playing session in the Subnautica universe. Dalanthir, Lycoris, Shaso and I were immersed in an original scenario written and animated by Yubels.

Follow the adventures of a crew dispatched to a distant ocean planet for a reconnaissance and rescue mission.

item.title: Physics, at large
item.description:
Members of the PogScience collective organized the first science marathon on Twitch. Thirteen streamers took turns throughout the event to offer continuous scientific content in French on the theme “Physics, at large” (in connection with the International Year of Physics). The 24h Vulga received support from the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique français (CNRS).

I co-organized a livestream with Thomas, from the channel Sciences à la Carte, where we hosted a knowledge quiz and presented capsules on the physical adaptations of species to abyssal conditions.

item.title: InstantOcean
item.description:
InstantOceans are video capsules created live with a science-on-demand format.

Using channel points during a livestream, viewers suggest a topic related to the oceans in the broadest sense: a scientific news, questions about concepts, debates, etc. I then search the internet for information to address the topic and explain it.

The moderators also created “Ocean GuessR,” where they give me clues so I can guess the region represented.

item.title: Chouettos Pass
item.description:
The Chouettos Pass is a level system offered to the community during live broadcasts.

Inspired by reputation levels in Sea of ​​Thieves, the goal is to accumulate experience to reach levels, which will unlock rewards. To do this, viewers must interact with the stream using their channel points , which will trigger various effects:

  • direct gains
  • science anecdotes competition
  • tchat mini games
  • in-game challenges
  • ...

Reaching levels 3, 5 and 8 unlocks premium command drops to modify live elements (camera filters, backgrounds, animations, etc.), and level 10 activates a gift card giveaway to use on Steam.

item.title: 24 hours of science
item.description:
I had the pleasure of producing and hosting a livestream for the 24 hours of science event.

Live from both the Baromètre at the Université du Québec à Rimouski and on Twitch, we collaborated with Québec Océan to produce an exceptional evening featuring scientific discussions and online quizzes. My guests were Gwénaëlle Chaillou (Ph.D.), professor of marine biogeochemistry, and Pierre Cauchy (Ph.D.), professor of marine acoustics.

Who is Dr Gwel?

I started streaming on Twitch in October 2021. Throughout my broadcasts, I’ve sought to build a community around topics I’m passionate about: gaming and science.

During each live, I aim to create a chill and welcoming atmosphere, constantly striving for quality and ambition in the resources I use. This applies to the hardware (which I acquired thanks to subscribers) and the software, scripts and interactive elements. I take great pleasure in connecting with my community to share my life as a researcher and experience unforgettable moments together.

Welcome on board!


I am DrGwel, marine ecologist and science communicator.

I produce online content focused on the oceans, using games like Sea of ​​Thieves and Subnautica to discuss current scientific news and present oceanographic concepts.
